Posts.Content: Hi Shirls I'm in a similar boat to you - 2 lots of surgery for the exact same reason, my last surgery was on 6th October.  I am Triple Negative, grade 3, clear lymph nodes, so Chemo and Rads are to follow but not seeing oncologist until 11th November.  Chemo is to make sure there's nothing floating around in my system after the surgery, and also, because I'm triple negative, chemo's my only option - Herceptin and Hormone blocking treatment won't be of any use.  I'm very nervous about it, but to be honest I've accepted it's going to happen and just want to get on with it now - I've already bought loads of snazzy head scarves and hats, and last Friday, I had my long hair cut really short which wasn't as taumatic as I thought it would be. Good luck with it all - let us know how you get on x
Posts.Title: treatment

Posts.Content: Well done Caroline, and best of luck to you Ali on your blood results - last thing you need now is a delay!! Getting my bloods done tomorrow in anticipation of final FEC on Friday - never ever thought I would actually be looking forward to a chemo session!!!
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: Brilliant news Ali - well done! Will be thinking of you tomorrow, and you Caroline x
Posts.Title: Thursday/Friday chemo kitties

Posts.Content: Hello! My WLE was last September, followed by 6 x FEC and 20 x Rads, the last rad was 6th May.  I saw my oncologist the following week, and she said she was now releasing me onto the "open access" thingy, which basically meant that they did not need to see me again unless I had any concerns, and I would now be put into the Annual screening programme.  I am Triple Neg, so no further treatments available such as Herceptin or Hormone therapy.  I actually asked her the question of what stage am I at now, for the purpose of, for example, travel insurance and such like, am I "All Clear"? and she replied "Basically, yes, all clear." But unless I had asked, I doubt she would have actually said those words. I would imagine you would be considered "All Clear" once your treatment finished completely. Not sure if this helps or not - maybe when you see your onco next you could ask the question directly, as I did?
Posts.Title: when is all clear?

Posts.Content: Thank you Jane, that was incredibly helpful, especially about the PICC line.  If they don't mention it tomorrow I will definitely request it. Thank you again, and I hope the rest of your treatment goes well (as well as it can be anyway!) Very best wishes to you and to everyone else x
Posts.Title: Questions about Oncology appointment

Posts.Content: Hello everyone I was diagnosed with a Grade 3 TNBC at end of Aug, had my WLE & SNB surgery on 15th Sept followed by further op on 6th Oct due to unclear margin.  I know I am to have 6 rounds of chemo followed by Rads, (from what the Consultant told me at my surgery follow up) and my first appointment with the Oncologist is tomorrow, but I have no idea what to expect when I get there.  It's been a long wait - will they tell me there and then when the chemo will start or will I have to wait for yet another appointment to come through the post?  Any idea when it's likely to start?  I was also told I may need to have some kind of line put in to administer the drugs - will they do that tomorrow or is that like another surgery type procedure?  Sorry, for the questions :-(
Posts.Title: Questions about Oncology appointment

Posts.Content: Thank you Cathy Yes my Hubby will be with me.  Good tip about the notebook!  I try to take it all in but then when I walk out I've forgotten half of what they've told me!!
Posts.Title: Questions about Oncology appointment

Posts.Content: Hi Janey I'm due my 3rd FEC this Friday.  I opted not to go with the cold cap - I hate the cold!  So I can't comment on that but my hair started falling out on day 18 of the first round - not loads but about 15 strands would come out when I rand my fingers through it.  Then on the day of the second lot, it really started to come out in handfuls, so the next day my hairdresser buzzed it all off to a number 4 for me.  It continued to come out over the next few days, short hairs were everywhere, so I had to wear a bandana indoors to try and stop the mess!  And I could "Pick it out like flowers" too!  Then it just stopped and no more has fallen out since.  I'm very thin and patchy but I do have some hair left, and not all body hair has gone either.  Will have to wait and see if any more falls out after Friday. I do like my scarves though - they are comfy and warm - I have loads and pick a different colour every day according to my outfit - I've only worn my wig once - on New Year's Eve!
Posts.Title: Hair falling out!

Posts.Content: Good luck!  I've just finished all mine - I'm a bit sore but it really is a doddle compared to chemo! It's downhill all the way now!  Best wishes x
Posts.Title: Finally started radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Ha ha! Sorry - I say it to mean the opposite to an uphill struggle!!
Posts.Title: Finally started radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Mine hurt!  And it's still slightly blue - had surgery back in September!!! Good luck for tomorrow x
Posts.Title: radioactive injection

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, hope you are all OK x I have recently finished all my treatment (WLE, SNB, 6 x FEC, 20 x Rads).  For the past few weeks I've been experiencing numbness & pins & needles in my right arm (Not my surgery side but the arm that had Picc line in) only at night though.  Also, when I grip something small, like a make-up brush or pen, my hand goes numb again.  I mentioned it to my Onco last week, but she never expressed any concern and just said to keep an eye on it. For the last few nights it's also been very painful, waking me up and keeping me awake - if I get up and shake my arm a bit, the pain goes but returns the moment I lay back down again - I was awake for most of the night last night!   Also got that feeling in my elbow, like my funny bone's been hit, but permanently!  Anyone else experienced anything similar?
Posts.Title: Arm pain, numbness, pins & needles, only at night.......?
I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Hi Amanda Thank you so much for this - yes please let me know how you get on.  I'm going to call my oncologist I think, it's pretty unbearable to be honest. Have a fantastic holiday x
Posts.Title: Arm pain, numbness, pins & needles, only at night.......?

Posts.Content: Thanks for all the replies - I think I will get the doc to check it out - I'm not sure I can put up wth it for long!
Posts.Title: Arm pain, numbness, pins & needles, only at night.......?

Posts.Content: Hi Ali, Good luck to you too! My bloods were a bit low last time and had to have them re-done the morning of chemo.  They also prescribed me Emend as I had a bad time sickness wise on FEC3 (Emend is absolutely brilliant, such a shame it's not prescribed from day 1 to everyone) They couldn't start chemo until an hour after I'd taken the Emend, and I couldn't take the Emend until the blood results came back good enough so all in all I ended up being there for 6 hours!  Hoping for good bloods this time. Can't wait for it all to end, but we're nearly there - take care, will be thinking of you on Thursday xx
Posts.Title: Thursday/ Friday chemo club

Posts.Content: Hi - I've only been here a very short time as I am very early on in my "journey".  I have already found it a great place for information, especially as I've not yet started chemo so it's really helped me to prepare for what's to come.  Everyone is so supportive. Good luck x
Posts.Title: breast cancer newbie
